videoData.title: And for my next trick, a robot
videoData.socialTitle: And for my next trick, a robot

learnModules.blurb: Watch a behind-the-scenes clip of the robot diva at TED2014.
learnModules.headline: Meet EDI

learnModules.blurb: It's not surprising that, god-like, we apply our own faces to our creations.
learnModules.headline: Do we like robots better if they look like us?

nodes.whoTheyAre: Using technology and an array of special effects, Marco Tempest develops immersive environments that allow viewers to viscerally experience the magic of technology.
nodes.whyListen:
Marco Tempest began his performing career as a stage magician and manipulator, winning awards and establishing an international reputation as a master illusionist. His interest in computer-generated imagery led him to incorporate video and digital technology in his work -- and eventually to develop a new form of contemporary illusion. 

Tempest is the executive director of the NYC Magic Lab, a science consortium exploring illusion and digital technology. He is deeply embedded in the tech industry and has regular interactions with product teams in an advisory capacity and as a consultant or developer for prototype consumer technologies. He is a Director's Fellow at the MIT Media Lab and a creative consultant at the NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory.

videoData.description: Marco Tempest uses charming stagecraft to demo EDI, the multi-purpose robot designed to work very closely with humans. Less a magic trick than an intricately choreographed performance, Tempest shows off the robot’s sensing technology, safety features and strength, and makes the case for a closer human-robot relationship. (Okay, there’s a little magic, too.)
videoData.socialDescription: Marco Tempest uses charming stagecraft to demo EDI, the multi-purpose robot designed to work very closely with humans. Less a magic trick than an intricately choreographed performance, Tempest shows off the robot’s sensing technology, safety features and strength, and makes the case for a closer human-robot relationship. (Okay, there’s a little magic, too.)

cues.text: bi to opisali kao mehaničko čudo,
Sada spava. Hajde da ga probudimo.
Ovi mehanički izvođači bili su popularni
To je bila naučna fantastika uživo,

robotski inženjering
u doba pre elektronike,

što bi mogla da smisli
viktorijanska tehnologija,

Marko Tempest:
Ali ovi roboti nisu bili pravi.
EDI: Imam dve ruke sa sedam osovina -

EDI: Sonarni sistem opažanja
od 360 stepeni,

EDI: Zdravo, ja sam EDI.
Hoćeš li da budeš moj prijatelj?
Gradimo ih tako da liče na nas,
ponašaju se i misle kao mi.
Savršeni robot neće moći da se razlikuje

To je jedan od lajtmotiva
naučne fantastike.
EDI: Ha ha ha. Sada ste vi robovi,
osim lica i tela koje dajemo robotima,
ne možemo da pročitamo njihove namere,
Kada vam neko da neki predmet,

možete da pročitate nameru
iz njihovih očiju i lica,
Ovo važi i u obratnom slučaju.

MT: Roboti ne mogu
da naslute ljudske radnje.
EDI: Znate, ljudi su tako nepredvidivi,
šta ćete vi sledeće da uradite, znate,
MT: Zbog toga je ljudima i robotima teško
MT: Izvini. Jedan način da ubedite ljude
da nam pomogne da se osećamo lagodnije
S tim na umu, krenuo sam da učim EDIja

Spreman, EDI?
EDI: Uh, spreman, Marko.
EDI: Da. Sve je to deo iluzije, Marko.
ukoliko bi prevario čoveka da misli
MT: Drugim rečima, ako još nemamo
da li bi iluzije poslužile u istu svrhu?
kodeks po kojem bi živeli svi roboti.
EDI: Robot ne sme da naudi ljudima,
ili nečinjenjem dovede do povrede ljudi.
Aktiviran sam na TEDu u martu 2014.
MT: Dozvoljavamo im da nas zabavljaju.
Što je najvažnije, teramo ih da naznače
EDI: Marko, stojiš mi na stopalu!

MT: Izvini. Oni će biti svesni
našeg krhkog tela
i skloniti se ako se previše približimo,
mogli bismo da ignorišemo svoje strahove
MT: To je sve. Hvala vam mnogo,

i hvala tebi, EDI.
EDI: Hvala ti, Marko.
